I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may think it's vulgar, sexist, offensive - and some hate it - but to me, it's parody. And, this may be one of the best scenarios ever for an all-star cast. I enjoy the story with its crazy situations, and I like the whole theme of being who

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat (Gloom, hereafter referred to as the feline creature) who has terrorized the town.
